00028 /* Includes ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00029 #include "ht32.h"
00030 #include "ht32_board.h"
00031 
00032 /** @addtogroup HT32_Series_Peripheral_Examples HT32 Peripheral Examples
00033   * @{

00035

00043

00045 /* Private function prototypes -----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00046 void LowPower_BootCheck(void);
00047 void LowPower_WAKEUPPin_Configuration(void);
00048 void LowPower_Enter(void);
00049 
00050 /* Global functions ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00051 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00052   * @brief  Main program.
00053   * @retval None
00054   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00055 int main(void)
00056 {
00057   vu32 i;
00058 
00059   RETARGET_Configuration();
00060 
00061   LowPower_BootCheck();
00062   LowPower_WAKEUPPin_Configuration();
00063 
00064   HT32F_DVB_LEDInit(HT_LED1);
00065   HT32F_DVB_LEDInit(HT_LED2);
00066   HT32F_DVB_LEDInit(HT_LED3);
00067   HT32F_DVB_LEDOn(HT_LED1);
00068   HT32F_DVB_LEDOn(HT_LED2);
00069   HT32F_DVB_LEDOn(HT_LED3);
00070 
00071   while (1)
00072   {
00073     // Waiting for a while before enter Power Down mode (for test)
00074     for (i = 0; i < 40000000; i++){};
00075 
00076     // If the WAKEUP pin is active, skip the low power mode.
00077     if (GPIO_ReadInBit(HT_GPIOB, GPIO_PIN_12) == SET)
00078     {
00079       continue;
00080     }
00081 
00082     HT32F_DVB_LEDOff(HT_LED1);
00083     HT32F_DVB_LEDOff(HT_LED2);
00084     HT32F_DVB_LEDOff(HT_LED3);
00085 
00086     // You shall make sure the WAKEUP pin is inactive before enter the low power mode.
00087     LowPower_Enter();
00088 
00089     // Never reacher here. Since the system will be restart when wakeup from the Power Down mode.
00090 
00091   }
00092 }
00093 
00094 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00095   * @brief  Related checking when bootup.
00096   * @retval None
00097   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00098 void LowPower_BootCheck(void)
00099 {
00100   u32 uBAKSR;
00101   CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{0}};
00102 
00103   CKCUClock.Bit.BKP        = 1;
00104   CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00105 
00106   uBAKSR = PWRCU_GetFlagStatus();
00107 
00108   // Must read clear the WAKEUP Pin Flag (WUPF) by PWRCU_GetFlagStatus()
00109   if ((uBAKSR & (PWRCU_FLAG_WUP0 | PWRCU_FLAG_PD)) == (PWRCU_FLAG_WUP0 | PWRCU_FLAG_PD))
00110   {
00111     // Means wakeup by WAKEUP pin, do your own process here
00112     printf("WAKEUP!\r\n");
00113   }
00114 
00115   /*
00116   // Since the flags read by PWRCU_GetFlagStatus() are read clear, you must check all the flag here
00117   if (uBAKSR & PWRCU_FLAG_XXXX)
00118   {
00119 
00120   }
00121   */
00122 
00123 }
00124 
00125 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00126   * @brief  EXTI Wakeup configuration.
00127   * @retval None
00128   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00129 void LowPower_WAKEUPPin_Configuration(void)
00130 {
00131   CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{0}};
00132 
00133   /* Enable EXTI & GPIO IP clock                                                                            */
00134   CKCUClock.Bit.PB         = 1;
00135   CKCUClock.Bit.AFIO       = 1;
00136   CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00137 
00138   /* Configure GPIO pull down, AFIO mode, and Input Enable                                                  */
00139   AFIO_GPxConfig(WAKEUP_BUTTON_GPIO_ID, WAKEUP_BUTTON_GPIO_PIN, AFIO_FUN_SYSTEM);
00140   GPIO_PullResistorConfig(GPIO_PORT[WAKEUP_BUTTON_GPIO_ID], WAKEUP_BUTTON_GPIO_PIN, GPIO_PR_DOWN);
00141   GPIO_InputConfig(GPIO_PORT[WAKEUP_BUTTON_GPIO_ID], WAKEUP_BUTTON_GPIO_PIN, ENABLE);
00142 }
00143 
00144 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00145   * @brief  Enter low power mode.
00146   * @retval None
00147   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00148 void LowPower_Enter(void)
00149 {
00150   PWRCU_WakeupPinCmd(ENABLE);
00151 
00152   PWRCU_PowerDown();
00153 }
